line_1: I Came, great bard, to gaze upon thy shrine,
line_2: And o'er thy relicks wait th' inspiring Nine:

line_1: And o'er thy relicks wait th' inspiring Nine:
line_2: I Came, great bard, to gaze upon thy shrine,

line_1: For sure, I said, where Maro's ashes sleep,
line_2: The weeping Muses must their vigils keep:

line_1: The weeping Muses must their vigils keep:
line_2: For sure, I said, where Maro's ashes sleep,

line_1: Still o'er their fav'rite's monument they mourn,
line_2: And with poetic trophies grace his urn:

line_1: And with poetic trophies grace his urn:
line_2: Still o'er their fav'rite's monument they mourn,

line_1: Have placed the shield and martial trumpet here;
line_2: The shepherd's pipe, and rural honours there:

line_1: The shepherd's pipe, and rural honours there:
line_2: Have placed the shield and martial trumpet here;

line_1: Fancy had deck'd the consecrated ground,
line_2: And scatter'd never-fading roses round.

line_1: And scatter'd never-fading roses round.
line_2: Fancy had deck'd the consecrated ground,

line_1: And now my bold romantic thought aspires
line_2: To hear the echo of celestial lyres;

line_1: To hear the echo of celestial lyres;
line_2: And now my bold romantic thought aspires

line_1: Then catch some sound to bear delighted home,
line_2: And boast I learnt the verse at Virgil's tomb;

line_1: And boast I learnt the verse at Virgil's tomb;
line_2: Then catch some sound to bear delighted home,

line_1: Or stretch'd beneath thy myrtle's fragrant shade,
line_2: With dreams extatic hov'ring o'er my head,

line_1: With dreams extatic hov'ring o'er my head,
line_2: Or stretch'd beneath thy myrtle's fragrant shade,

line_1: See forms august, and laurel'd ghosts ascend,
line_2: And with thyself, perhaps, the long procession end.

line_1: And with thyself, perhaps, the long procession end.
line_2: See forms august, and laurel'd ghosts ascend,

line_1: I came — but soon the phantoms disappear'd;
line_2: Far other scenes, than wanton Hope had rear'd;

line_1: Far other scenes, than wanton Hope had rear'd;
line_2: I came — but soon the phantoms disappear'd;

line_1: No faery rites, no funeral pomp I found;
line_2: No trophied walls with wreaths of laurel round:

line_1: No trophied walls with wreaths of laurel round:
line_2: No faery rites, no funeral pomp I found;

line_1: A mean unhonour'd ruin faintly show'd
line_2: The spot where once thy mausoleum stood:

line_1: The spot where once thy mausoleum stood:
line_2: A mean unhonour'd ruin faintly show'd

line_1: Hardly the form remain'd; a nodding dome
line_2: O'ergrown with moss is now all Virgil's tomb.

line_1: O'ergrown with moss is now all Virgil's tomb.
line_2: Hardly the form remain'd; a nodding dome

line_1: 'Twas such a scene as gave a kind relief
line_2: To memory, in sweetly-pensive grief:

line_1: To memory, in sweetly-pensive grief:
line_2: 'Twas such a scene as gave a kind relief

line_1: Gloomy, unpleasing images it wrought;
line_2: No musing, soft complacency of thought:

line_1: No musing, soft complacency of thought:
line_2: Gloomy, unpleasing images it wrought;

line_1: For Time had canker'd all, and worn away
line_2: Ev'n the last, mournful graces of decay:

line_1: Ev'n the last, mournful graces of decay:
line_2: For Time had canker'd all, and worn away

line_1: Oblivion, hateful goddess, sate before,
line_2: And cover'd with her dusky wings the door:

line_1: And cover'd with her dusky wings the door:
line_2: Oblivion, hateful goddess, sate before,

line_1: No silver harps I heard, no Muse's voice,
line_2: But birds obscene in horrid notes rejoice:

line_1: But birds obscene in horrid notes rejoice:
line_2: No silver harps I heard, no Muse's voice,

line_1: Fancy recoil'd, and with his tinsel train,
line_2: Forsook the chearless scene; no more remain

line_1: Forsook the chearless scene; no more remain
line_2: Fancy recoil'd, and with his tinsel train,

line_1: The warm ambitious hopes of airy youth;
line_2: Severe Reflection came, and frowning Truth:

line_1: Severe Reflection came, and frowning Truth:
line_2: The warm ambitious hopes of airy youth;

line_1: Away each glitt'ring gay idea fled,
line_2: And bade a melancholy train succeed,

line_1: And bade a melancholy train succeed,
line_2: Away each glitt'ring gay idea fled,

line_1: That form'd, or seem'd to form, a mournful call
line_2: In feeble echoes mutt'ring round the wall.

line_1: In feeble echoes mutt'ring round the wall.
line_2: That form'd, or seem'd to form, a mournful call

line_1: Seek not the Muses here! th' affrighted maids
line_2: Have fled Parthenope's polluted shades:

line_1: Have fled Parthenope's polluted shades:
line_2: Seek not the Muses here! th' affrighted maids

line_1: Her happy shores, the seats of joy and ease,
line_2: Their fav'rite mansions once, no longer please:

line_1: Their fav'rite mansions once, no longer please:
line_2: Her happy shores, the seats of joy and ease,

line_1: No longer, as of old, in transport lost,
line_2: The sisters rove along th' enchanted coast;

line_1: The sisters rove along th' enchanted coast;
line_2: No longer, as of old, in transport lost,

line_1: They turn with horror from each much-lov'd stream,
line_2: And loath the fields that were their darling theme:

line_1: And loath the fields that were their darling theme:
line_2: They turn with horror from each much-lov'd stream,

line_1: The tuneful names themselves once fondly gave
line_2: To ev'ry swelling hill, and mossy cave,

line_1: To ev'ry swelling hill, and mossy cave,
line_2: The tuneful names themselves once fondly gave

line_1: So pleasing then, are only heard with sighs;
line_2: And each sad echo bids their sorrow rise.

line_1: And each sad echo bids their sorrow rise.
line_2: So pleasing then, are only heard with sighs;

line_1: Yet Nature smiles, as when their Virgil sung,
line_2: Nor 'midst a fairer scene his lyre was strung;

line_1: Nor 'midst a fairer scene his lyre was strung;
line_2: Yet Nature smiles, as when their Virgil sung,

line_1: Still bloom the sweets of his elysium here,
line_2: And the same charms in ev'ry grove appear.

line_1: And the same charms in ev'ry grove appear.
line_2: Still bloom the sweets of his elysium here,

line_1: But ah! in vain indulgent suns prevail;
line_2: Health and delight in ev'ry balmy gale

line_1: Health and delight in ev'ry balmy gale
line_2: But ah! in vain indulgent suns prevail;

line_1: Are wafted now in vain: small comfort bring
line_2: To weeping eyes the beauties of the spring.

line_1: To weeping eyes the beauties of the spring.
line_2: Are wafted now in vain: small comfort bring

line_1: To groaning slaves those fragrant meads belong,
line_2: Where Tully dictated, and Maro sung.

line_1: Where Tully dictated, and Maro sung.
line_2: To groaning slaves those fragrant meads belong,

line_1: Long since, alas! those golden days are flown,
line_2: Where here each Science wore its proper crown;

line_1: Where here each Science wore its proper crown;
line_2: Long since, alas! those golden days are flown,

line_1: Pale Tyranny had laid their altars low,
line_2: And rent the laurel from the Muse's brow:

line_1: And rent the laurel from the Muse's brow:
line_2: Pale Tyranny had laid their altars low,

line_1: What wonder then 'midst such a scene to see
line_2: The Arts expire with bleeding Liberty?

line_1: The Arts expire with bleeding Liberty?
line_2: What wonder then 'midst such a scene to see

line_1: Pensive and sad, each fair angelic form
line_2: Droops, like the wearied dove beneath a storm:

line_1: Droops, like the wearied dove beneath a storm:
line_2: Pensive and sad, each fair angelic form

line_1: Far other views the poet's thought engage,
line_2: Than the warm glories of th' Augustan age.

line_1: Than the warm glories of th' Augustan age.
line_2: Far other views the poet's thought engage,

line_1: Can mis'ry bid th' imagination glow?
line_2: Or genius brighten 'midst domestic woe?

line_1: Or genius brighten 'midst domestic woe?
line_2: Can mis'ry bid th' imagination glow?

line_1: To see desponding wretches round him pine,
line_2: Horace had wept beneath the Alban vine.

line_1: Horace had wept beneath the Alban vine.
line_2: To see desponding wretches round him pine,

line_1: Sad sits the bard amidst his country's tears,
line_2: And sighs, regardless of the wreaths he wears.

line_1: And sighs, regardless of the wreaths he wears.
line_2: Sad sits the bard amidst his country's tears,

line_1: Did ever Want and Famine sweetly sing?
line_2: The fetter'd hand uncouthly strikes the string.

line_1: The fetter'd hand uncouthly strikes the string.
line_2: Did ever Want and Famine sweetly sing?

line_1: Lo! stern Oppression lifts her iron rod,
line_2: And Ruin waits th' imperious harpy's nod:

line_1: And Ruin waits th' imperious harpy's nod:
line_2: Lo! stern Oppression lifts her iron rod,

line_1: Black Desolation, and destructive War,
line_2: Rise at the signal, and attend her car.

line_1: Rise at the signal, and attend her car.
line_2: Black Desolation, and destructive War,

line_1: From the dire pomp th' affrighted shepherd flies,
line_2: And leaves his flock the rav'nous soldier's prize.

line_1: And leaves his flock the rav'nous soldier's prize.
line_2: From the dire pomp th' affrighted shepherd flies,

line_1: Where now are all the nymphs that blest the plains?
line_2: Where, the full chorus of contented swains?

line_1: Where, the full chorus of contented swains?
line_2: Where now are all the nymphs that blest the plains?

line_1: The songs of love, of liberty and peace,
line_2: Are heard no more; the dance and tabor cease:

line_1: Are heard no more; the dance and tabor cease:
line_2: The songs of love, of liberty and peace,

line_1: To the soft oaten pipe, and past'ral reed,
line_2: The din of arms, and clarion's blast succeed:

line_1: The din of arms, and clarion's blast succeed:
line_2: To the soft oaten pipe, and past'ral reed,

line_1: Dire shapes appear in ev'ry op'ning glade;
line_2: And Furies howl where once the Muses stray'd?

line_1: And Furies howl where once the Muses stray'd?
line_2: Dire shapes appear in ev'ry op'ning glade;

line_1: Is this the queen of realms, for arts renown'd?
line_2: This captive maid, that weeps upon the ground!

line_1: This captive maid, that weeps upon the ground!
line_2: Is this the queen of realms, for arts renown'd?

line_1: Alas! how chang'd! — dejected and forlorn!
line_2: The mistress of the world become the scorn!

line_1: The mistress of the world become the scorn!
line_2: Alas! how chang'd! — dejected and forlorn!

line_1: Around stand Rapine, Horror and Despair;
line_2: And Ign'rance, dark ally of barb'rous War:

line_1: And Ign'rance, dark ally of barb'rous War:
line_2: Around stand Rapine, Horror and Despair;

line_1: She, at th' usurping Vandal's dread command,
line_2: Displays her gloomy banner o'er the land:

line_1: Displays her gloomy banner o'er the land:
line_2: She, at th' usurping Vandal's dread command,

line_1: Beneath its chilling shade neglected lies
line_2: Each sister Art; and unlamented dies.

line_1: Each sister Art; and unlamented dies.
line_2: Beneath its chilling shade neglected lies

line_1: Lo! Sculpture lets her useless chissel fall;
line_2: While on some ruin'd temple's broken wall

line_1: While on some ruin'd temple's broken wall
line_2: Lo! Sculpture lets her useless chissel fall;

line_1: Sad Architecture sits; and sees with shame
line_2: Mis-shapen piles usurp her injur'd name:

line_1: Mis-shapen piles usurp her injur'd name:
line_2: Sad Architecture sits; and sees with shame

line_1: Music and Verse, unhappy twins! belong
line_2: To antique Masque, and weak unmanly Song:

line_1: To antique Masque, and weak unmanly Song:
line_2: Music and Verse, unhappy twins! belong

line_1: The gath'ring deluge swells on ev'ry side,
line_2: And monkish Superstition swells the tide.

line_1: And monkish Superstition swells the tide.
line_2: The gath'ring deluge swells on ev'ry side,

line_1: By the resistless torrent overborn
line_2: Floats ev'ry Virtue, from its basis torn:

line_1: Floats ev'ry Virtue, from its basis torn:
line_2: By the resistless torrent overborn

line_1: Fair Learning droops, the sick'ning Arts decay;
line_2: And ev'ry laurel fades, and ev'ry bay.

line_1: And ev'ry laurel fades, and ev'ry bay.
line_2: Fair Learning droops, the sick'ning Arts decay;

line_1: All is confus'd, no traces now are seen
line_2: To shew what wretched Italy has been.

line_1: To shew what wretched Italy has been.
line_2: All is confus'd, no traces now are seen

line_1: Thus once Vesuvius, crown'd with circling wood,
line_2: Parthenope, thy beauteous neighbour stood:

line_1: Parthenope, thy beauteous neighbour stood:
line_2: Thus once Vesuvius, crown'd with circling wood,

line_1: Perpetual Spring cloath'd the fair mountain's side;
line_2: And what is now thy terror, was thy pride.

line_1: And what is now thy terror, was thy pride.
line_2: Perpetual Spring cloath'd the fair mountain's side;

line_1: Sudden th' imprison'd flames burst forth; and laid
line_2: On smoaky heaps each shrieking Dryad's shade:

line_1: On smoaky heaps each shrieking Dryad's shade:
line_2: Sudden th' imprison'd flames burst forth; and laid

line_1: Now deep in ashes sinks the myrtle bow'r,
line_2: O'er beds of flow'rs sulphureous torrents roar;

line_1: Now deep in ashes sinks the myrtle bow'r,
line_2: And exil'd demi-gods their ruin'd seats deplore.
